str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A verbal defense (particularly in a law court). From the same as apologeomai; a plea.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
